resources.string: 1. How high can you get from industrial hemp?
2. One acre of hemp will produce ... fiber as 1 acre of cotton.
3. One acre of hemp will produce as much paper as … acre(s) of trees.
4. A crop of hemp can be harvested after … days.
5. Can you build a house out of hemp?
6. Can hemp seeds be used as food?
Yes, but again, I prefer candy!
No, I just want my score..

"1. Hemp grown for industrial use, has no drug properties because of its low THC content." + "

2. Hemp fiber is stronger than cotton, lasts 2x as long and doesn’t get mildew" + "

3. Hemp paper lasts hundreds of years without degrading. Can be recycled many more times than tree-based paper, and requires less toxic chemicals in the manufacturing process than paper made from trees does. Fun fact: the US constitution was written on hemp paper." + "

4. Trees take years to grow and harvesting hemp rather than trees would also eliminate erosion due to logging, thereby reducing topsoil loss and water pollution caused by soil runoff." + "

5. Hemp's useful for home building because walls made from hemp are rot-free, pest-free, mold-free and fire-resistant. Hemp plastics are also completely biodegradable." + "

6. Hemp seeds contain high levels of vitamins A, B, D, and E, as well as vital minerals, proteins, and fatty acids. It has powerful antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antimicrobial properties. High levels of omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids make hemp oil healthier than most vegetable oils on the market."
